page.title: Quick Start
page.text: Here's a quick guide to Help you get started.
If you want to try the app first and read this guide later, look in the Settings window and click the "Quick Start" button.
Swipe left to navigate to the next page.

page.title: YouTube Channels
page.text: This app is a minimalist video player for watching YouTube videos.
This app contains a collection of the top channels in it's category.
This specific app contains the following YouTube channels.
This is the first app of the series, but more apps covering more categories are coming soon.

page.title: Navigation
page.text: This app tries to keep things as simple as possible and we try to follow the Android design guidelines so things should be very familiar and easy to learn.
page.bullet: Scrolling list view with cards UI
page.text: If you swipe to dismiss an item, don't worry it's still there. Just click the action menu in the action bar, choose 'Show hidden items' and click the cards you want to unhide. Select 'Hide hidden items' in the menu to get back to normal.

page.title: The Basics
page.text: The first thing you'll see is the 'about page' of the default channel.
Every channel has an about page with an image and a description of the channel.
Click on the image or the "Watch Now" button. They both takes you to the channel's list of playlists.
A playlist is a collection of videos organized by the channel administrator.
Clicking on a playlist shows a list of videos. Clicking on a video plays the video.
Changing channels is simple. Click on the popup menu control on the left side of the action bar at the top of the screen.
To navigate within the current channel. Show the slide out navigation drawer by clicking the top left icon in the action bar, or by swiping from the left side of the screen.
The navigation drawer contains the About page, Playlists and Recent Uploads page.
That's basically it, try it out and I'm sure you'll get the hang of it right away.

page.title: Video player
page.text: When in portrait mode videos play in a custom video player. You can still scroll the video list while a video is playing. Turning the phone to landscape mode seemlessly continues playback without rebuffering.
page.bullet: Clicking duration pops down a custom scrub slider

page.title: Find
page.text: There is a find button in the Action Bar. This searches the current list and will display any matches in the title or description for playlists and videos.
The find feature only searches the current list and not every video or playlist contained in all lists or channels.

Why doesn't it search everything within the app? That would require downloading everything all at once and the app only downloads data as lists are displayed. It's more of a filter for the current list rather than a global search. This makes it both fast and efficient.
After viewing the find results, click the find button again to clear the current search and display the whole list.

page.title: Why is this better?
page.text: YouTube has an incredible selection of interesting videos. The problem is finding those videos and keeping track of channels you like.
Sure there are subscriptions, but after subscribing to dozens of channels, now you have to navigate though a large subscription list every time you feel like watching a video.

Launching apps is the simplest most straight forward UI on a mobile device. It's simple and does one clear task. Wouldn't it be nice if you were in the mood for tech news you could just click the tech news app?
This is what this application attempts to do. Make watching videos a little bit simpler.
And there are additional apps just like this you can download that cover additional topics.
